bibl.title: Short Genitive or Egyptian Name-Form?
bibl.note: When we read a form of a proper name which can be explained as a (short) genitive in a position where a genitive is expected there can be no doubt that we have to explain that form as a (short) genitive [and not as an indeclinable proper name].
bibl.seg: Sijpesteijn Pieter Johannes, Short Genitive or Egyptian Name-Form?

When we read a form of a proper name which can be explained as a (short) genitive in a position where a genitive is expected there can be no doubt that we have to explain that form as a (short) genitive [and not as an indeclinable proper name].
